Content.Text:
<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Good morning, <MYNAME>. It's Veronica.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I'm sorry to disturb you at this hour.
<PAGE>
I have something important to discuss with all
the town's farmers. Would you mind coming to
the guild?

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Thank you. Shall we be going?

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Good morning, everyone.
<PAGE>
I'm sure you all know why I have asked you to
come here this morning.
<PAGE>
The town has already been allowing farmers to
rent publicly-owned fields and use them as
extensions of their own farms.
<PAGE>
By now, you are all aware that each field has
certain crops that grow best in it.
<PAGE>
To be honest, we deliberately planned the fields
that way.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
Starting today, all of you will be in competition
with each other for the right to rent each field.

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SPECIAL>
Oh? Such an effort is hardly necessary. I can
simply buy them all from you. You have but to
name your price!

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
I'm afraid that's not going to happen. The goal
here is for all of you to compete, improving the
land and yourselves as you go.
<PAGE>
<FACE_ANGRY>This is something I've discussed with everyone
in town, starting with Madam Eda.
<PAGE>
By challenging each other, you'll demonstrate
why you would be the best holder of the land,
and thus bring prosperity to Oak Tree Town.

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Hmph! Very well, then. I shall relish showing all
of you the gulf in skill between you and I!

<FACE_GEORGES><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Heh. It looks like things are warming up, but the
joke's on all of you - I'm ALREADY hot. Bring on
the competition.

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
All riiiiiight! I'm gonna eat my vegetables and
work circles around everyone else!

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Now then, allow me to explain how you'll be
competing against each other.
<PAGE>
First, as you are already aware, you can apply to
rent a public field for a limited time at the guild
counter.
<PAGE>
<FACE_ANGRY>For the length of that rental period, only the
renter may use that field. However, after the
rental permit expires...
<PAGE>
...The field will be available for anyone to rent.
Those who are interested will enter into a
competition with each other.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>The competition may take one of many forms,
such as your ranking in <RED>yearly events</RED> or the
quantity of <RED>shipped goods</RED>.
<PAGE>
Whoever comes out on top will be granted
permission to lease the field. We'll call the
competition "Conquest" for fun.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
That is the extent of my explanation. I have taken
the liberty of distributing a booklet on the
subject that you can read if you have questions.

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SPECIAL>
Oho, that sounds far more interesting than I was
expecting!

<FACE_GEORGES><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Well now. This sounds promising.

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
I'm kinda confused about all the details and
stuff, but basically, you've just gotta win, right?

<FACE_EDDA><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
I'm sorry I stayed mum about this, everyone.
However, as a farmer, I'll be joining you in the
competition.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
All right, then. Beginning today, the guild will be
accepting applications for rental permits. Good
luck, everyone.
<BLUE>Renting Fields</BLUE> was added to the bookshelf.
<BLUE>Beekeeping</BLUE> was added to the bookshelf.
<BLUE>Growing Mushrooms</BLUE> was added to the shelf.
